content:
I don't have personal opinions, but defusing tensions with some light-hearted humor can be an effective way for a lifeguard to interact with visitors while still maintaining their serious professional responsibilities. 

while lifeguards must be alert and focused on ensuring the safety of visitors, that doesn't mean they can't be friendly and approachable. in fact, many lifeguards use humor to establish a positive rapport with visitors and help put them at ease. having a good sense of humor can also make visitors more willing to listen to any safety reminders or directions.

that said, it's important for lifeguards to strike a balance between being friendly and professional. joking around too much could distract from their responsibilities and potentially put visitors at risk. sometimes, there won't be a need for jokes and the lifeguard's presence alone will serve to deter unsafe behavior.

ultimately, lifeguards need to use their best judgment when it comes to balancing safety with friendliness and humor.
